highlighted_text: 21Humankind
SECTION

Your allies are God,

His messenger, and the believers

who are steadfast in prayer

and charity, bowing [in worship].

Say, “Do you worship

something other than God

which has the power

neither to do you harm or good?”

God is All Hearing, All Knowing.
always
When they hear
pride
games of chance
enmity

be mindful of God,

to Whom you will be gathered.

You who possess insight,

that you might flourish.”

inventing a lie against God,

for most of them do not

make use of reason.

You

were Watching over them, and You

are Witness to all things.

if You forgive them—

You are the Almighty, All Wise.”

It is He Who created you from clay,

then decreed for you a term,

—then a fixed term with Him°—

yet still you are in doubt.

but those who have lost their souls,

will not believe.

and if He touches you

with good—it is He

Who has Power over all things.

He is the Omnipotent, far above

His worshippers, and

He is the All Wise, All Aware.

how the gods they invented

have abandoned them.
A

What is the life of this world

but play and a pastime?

The home of the hereafter is better

for those who are mindful of God.

Will you not, then, use reason?

All creatures on the earth,

and all birds that fly on their wings,

are communities,° like you.

We have overlooked nothing

in the Book—then, to their Lord

they shall be gathered.

Satan

made their actions seem fair to them.
S
A
Peace be with you.
did wrong in ignorance
Say, “I stand upon clear proof

from my Lord, while you deny it.

What you seek to hasten is

not in my power—the decision is

with God alone. He relates the truth,

for He is the Best of Arbiters.”

It is He Who calls back your souls

by night

Then they shall be returned

to God, their true Protector.

split you into factions, to let you

taste one another’s aggression.

for they

always denied the truth.

“Why should I fear what you

join with Him, when you

have no fear of joining partners

with God, for which no sanction

has been sent down to you?

So, which of our two parties

has more right to feel secure?

[Tell me], if you know.

It is He Who made for you

the stars, to guide you

in the darkness of land and sea.

We have made Our signs clear

for a people who know.

It is He Who sends down rain

from the sky—from this

We bring out every plant, from which

We bring greenery, out of which

We bring grain in heaped piles;

and from the spathes of date palm,

low-hanging clusters of dates,

gardens of grapevines, olives, and

pomegranates—all alike yet diverse.

See their fruits as they bear fruit

and ripen—in all this are signs

for people who believe.

except those who repent,

reform themselves, and openly

declare [the truth]. To those I relent,

for I am Relenting, Ever Merciful.

who give their wealth

—despite their love of it—

for kin, for orphans, the needy,

the traveler, for those who ask,

and for freeing slaves;

who are steadfast in prayer,

who give in charity,
They shall have what they earned

There are others who pray,

“Our Lord, grant us good in

this world and in the hereafter,

and deliver us from

the torment of fire.”

do you think you will

enter the garden without facing

the trials imposed

on those before you?

They were struck by misfortune

and hardship, and were so shaken

that their messenger and those

who believed with him

cried, “When will the help

of God come?” Without doubt,

the help of God is near.

God will not call you to account

for oaths you spoke unintentionally,

but He will call you to account

for what your hearts have earned

Their prophet said to them,

“God has appointed Saul as your King.”

They said, “How can he be our king

when we have more right to kingship than him?

has granted him much knowledge,

and a fair form.

And he has not even been granted

much wealth.” The prophet replied,

“God has chosen him over you, and

God will test you

at the river.

If God did not restrain

some people by others, the earth

would be corrupt—but God is

Full of Grace to humankind.

There shall be no compulsion

in religion; true guidance is now

distinct from error.

Whoever denies false gods

and believes in the One God

has grasped the firmest handhold,

which shall never break—for God

is All Hearing, All Knowing.

Kind words and forgiveness

are better than charity followed

by hurt—and God

is Self-Sufficient, Forbearing.

A parable: those who spend

their wealth in God’s cause are like

a grain of corn that grows seven ears,

and each ear bears a hundred grains.

God gives in abundance

to whom He will,

for He is Expansive, All Knowing.
notes: a ga pata to hoba tie-na

highlighted_text:
You who believe, don’t annul

your acts of charity by reminders

or hurtfulness, like those who

spend their wealth only to be seen

of people—those who don’t

believe in God and the last day

Another parable: those

who spend their wealth seeking

to please God and assure their souls

are like a garden lodged on a height;

heavy rain falls on it and its yield

is doubled; and if not heavy rain,

even the dew will water it—

God Sees all that you do.

They are like a smooth rock

covered with soil;

heavy rain falls on it

and leaves it bare.

They have no power

over what they reap,

for God does not guide

a people who disbelieve.

He grants wisdom to whom

He will, and whoever gains wisdom

has been granted great good;

but only those with insight

will take heed.

If you reveal your deeds

of charity, that is fine; but if you

conceal them, and give to the poor,

this is better for you

and will atone

for some of your bad deeds,

You who believe,

be mindful of God

and give up any

gain left from usury

if you are truly believers.

If the debtor is in hardship,

grant postponement

until their plight is eased.

But if you charitably

forgo the loan,

this is better for you,

if only you knew.

The messenger believes

in what was revealed to him

by His Lord, as do the true believers.

They all believe in God, His angels,

His Books, and His messengers.

[They say], “We make no distinction

between any of His messengers.”

And they say, “We hear and we obey.

We seek your forgiveness, our Lord,

and to you is our final journey.”

God burdens no soul beyond

its means; what it earns

will be for it or against it.

“Our Lord, don’t take us to task

if we forget or err.

Don’t burden us with the load

you laid upon those before us.

Our Lord, don’t lay a burden on us

which we lack strength to bear.

Pardon us, forgive us, and

show mercy to us.

You are our Protector, so help us

against people who disbelieve.”

Say, “If you love God,

follow me. God will love you

and forgive you your sins, for God

is Forgiving, Ever Merciful.”
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
Her Lord graciously accepted her,

nurtured her immaculately,

entrusting her to the care

of Zachariah. Whenever

he entered her sanctuary, he found her

supplied with provisions. He asked,

“Mary, where did you get these?”

She replied, “They are from God.

God provides without measure

for those whom He will.”
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
He chooses whom He will

for His mercy—

God’s grace is great.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
No person to whom God

had given the Book, and wisdom,

and prophethood, would say

to the people,

“Worship me, instead of God.”

Rather, he would say,

“Be one of the learned,°

for you have taught the Book,

as you have studied it.”
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
Do they seek something other

than the religion of God?
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)
Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
You shall never attain

righteousness unless you give

freely from what you love; and God

Knows fully what you give.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
be mindful of God, as is His due,

and do not die without

submitting to His will.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text: You who believe,
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
You who believe, do not devour

interest from usury, doubled and

multiplied; but be mindful of God

that you might flourish.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
those who give freely

in both prosperity and adversity,

who restrain their anger, and

pardon others. For God loves

those who do good,
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
And how many prophets fought,

alongside many pious men,

but they never lost heart when

calamity struck them, in God’s path,

nor did they weaken or give up.

God loves those who are steadfast.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text: make firm our feet,
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
when you decide on something,

place your trust in God, for God

loves those who trust in Him.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
If God helps you,

none can overcome you.

If He forsakes you, who

can help you?

So let the believers

trust in God.
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
when

misfortune strikes you
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
even though

you have struck your foes with twice

as much
notes: যদিও আপনি আপনার শত্রুদের দ্বিগুণ আঘাত করেছেন
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
“Where is this from?”

Say, “It is from yourselves
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text: God has Power over all things
toc_family_titles: Sura 3: The Family of ʿImran (Al ʿImran)

highlighted_text:
If you avoid the major sins

that are forbidden to you,

We shall absolve you

of your minor sins,

and let you enter with honor.

God does not wrong anyone

even by the weight of an atom.

If there is any good done,

He doubles it, and He grants

from Himself a great reward.

do they have a share

in His kingdom? Even then,

they would give to people

not even the pith of a date seed.

If We had enjoined them

to lay down their lives

or leave their homes,

only a few of them

would have complied.

But had they done

what they were advised to do,

that would have been

better for them, and would have

strengthened them

You need answer only for yourself,

and urge on the believers
striving
notes: make great efforts to achieve or obtain something. চেষ্টা

highlighted_text: The believers who remain behind
and their lives

—excepting the disabled—

are not equal to those
in the cause of God, with their wealth

God grants

a higher rank to those who so strive

over those who remain.

God has promised good for all,

but He will favor those who strive

over those who remain, with

a great reward,

conferring on them exalted rank,

forgiveness and mercy. For God

is Forgiving, Ever Merciful.

Even after finishing prayer,

keep remembering God,

whether standing, sitting,

or lying on your sides.

And when you feel secure,

resume regular prayer—

prayer is enjoined for believers

at appointed times.

There’s no virtue

in most of their furtive talk—unless

one of them enjoins charity, kindness,

or harmony between people.

To anyone who does this, seeking

to please God, We shall grant

a great reward.
as friend.

To God belongs

all that is in the heavens and

all that is on the earth. He

suffices as Guardian of all trust.

As for those who take

disbelievers as allies rather than

believers: is it power they seek

through them? All power

belongs to God alone.

If a wife fears ill conduct

or desertion by her husband,

neither of them will be culpable

if they reach a mutual agreement,

for this is better.°

People are prone to avarice,

but if you do good deeds

and are mindful of Him,

God is Aware of what you do.

However, We shall grant

a great reward to those

firmly rooted in knowledge

among them and the believers,

who believe in what was

revealed to you, and what was

revealed before you;

who are steadfast in prayer,

who give in charity, and

who believe in God

and the last day.

People of the Book,

don’t be excessive in your religion,

nor speak anything

but the truth about God.

those who are disdainful, proud—

they shall not find any protector

or any helper besides God.

I have chosen as your religion

submission to My will.

Each person has a train of angels

before them and behind them,

guarding them by God’s command.

God never changes a people’s state

until they change what is in themselves.

When God intends ill for a people,

there is no turning it back.

Besides Him, they have no protector.
